camel.sink.path.defaultChannel.name: camel.sink.path.defaultChannel
camel.sink.path.defaultChannel.description: The default channel name which is used by the Spring Integration Spring context. It will equal to the inputChannel name for the Spring Integration consumer and the outputChannel name for the Spring Integration provider.

camel.sink.endpoint.inOut.name: camel.sink.endpoint.inOut
camel.sink.endpoint.inOut.description: The exchange pattern that the Spring integration endpoint should use. If inOut=true then a reply channel is expected, either from the Spring Integration Message header or configured on the endpoint.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.outputChannel.name: camel.sink.endpoint.outputChannel
camel.sink.endpoint.outputChannel.description: The Spring integration output channel name that is used to send messages to Spring integration.

camel.component.spring-integration.lazyS.name: camel.component.spring-integration.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.spring-integration.lazyS.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.spring-integration.autow.name: camel.component.spring-integration.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.spring-integration.autow.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
